db:abstract.db:para: The QTextDocument class holds formatted text.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QTextDocument is part of Rich Text Processing APIs

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QTextDocument is a container for structured rich text documents, providing support for styled text and various types of document elements, such as lists, tables, frames, and images. They can be created for use in a QTextEdit, or used independently.

Each document element is described by an associated format object. Each format object is treated as a unique object by QTextDocuments, and can be passed to objectForFormat() to obtain the document element that it is applied to.

A QTextDocument can be edited programmatically using a QTextCursor, and its contents can be examined by traversing the document structure. The entire document structure is stored as a hierarchy of document elements beneath the root frame, found with the rootFrame() function. Alternatively, if you just want to iterate over the textual contents of the document you can use begin(), end(), and findBlock() to retrieve text blocks that you can examine and iterate over.

The layout of a document is determined by the documentLayout(); you can create your own QAbstractTextDocumentLayout subclass and set it using setDocumentLayout() if you want to use your own layout logic. The document's title and other meta-information can be obtained by calling the metaInformation() function. For documents that are exposed to users through the QTextEdit class, the document title is also available via the QTextEdit::documentTitle() function.
The toPlainText() and toHtml() convenience functions allow you to retrieve the contents of the document as plain text and HTML. The document's text can be searched using the find() functions.

Undo/redo of operations performed on the document can be controlled using the setUndoRedoEnabled() function. The undo/redo system can be controlled by an editor widget through the undo() and redo() slots; the document also provides contentsChanged(), undoAvailable(), and redoAvailable() signals that inform connected editor widgets about the state of the undo/redo system. The following are the undo/redo operations of a QTextDocument:

db:listitem.db:para: Insertion or removal of characters. A sequence of insertions or removals within the same text block are regarded as a single undo/redo operation.
Insertion or removal of text blocks. Sequences of insertion or removals in a single operation (e.g., by selecting and then deleting text) are regarded as a single undo/redo operation.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextDocument::FindFlag
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the options available to QTextDocument's find function. The options can be OR-ed together from the following list:

db:td.db:para: By default find works case insensitive. Specifying this option changes the behaviour to a case sensitive find operation.
Makes find match only complete words.

db:section.db:para: The FindFlags type is a typedef for QFlags<FindFlag>. It stores an OR combination of FindFlag values.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextDocument::MetaInformation
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the different types of meta information that can be added to a document.

db:td.db:para: The url of the document. The loadResource() function uses this url as the base when loading relative resources.
This value is used to select the corresponding '@media' rule, if any, from a specified CSS stylesheet when setHtml() is called. This enum value has been introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [alias, since 6.1] QTextDocument::ResourceProvider
db:section.db:para: Type alias for std::function<QVariant(const QUrl&)>.
This typedef was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: enum QTextDocument::ResourceType
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the types of resources that can be loaded by QTextDocument's loadResource() function or by QTextBrowser::setSource().

db:td.db:para: No resource is loaded, or the resource type is not known.

The resource contains image data. Currently supported data types are QMetaType::QPixmap and QMetaType::QImage. If the corresponding variant is of type QMetaType::QByteArray then Qt attempts to load the image using QImage::loadFromData. QMetaType::QIcon is currently not supported. The icon needs to be converted to one of the supported types first, for example using QIcon::pixmap.
The first available value for user defined resource types.
Both the undo and redo stacks.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] baseUrl : QUrl
db:section.db:para: This property holds the base URL used to resolve relative resource URLs within the document.
Resource URLs are resolved to be within the same directory as the target of the base URL meaning any portion of the path after the last '/' will be ignored.
This property was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] blockCount : const int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the number of text blocks in the document.
The value of this property is undefined in documents with tables or frames.
By default, if defined, this property contains a value of 1.

db:section.db:title: defaultFont : QFont
db:section.db:para: This property holds the default font used to display the document's text

db:section.db:title: defaultStyleSheet : QString
db:section.db:para: The default style sheet is applied to all newly HTML formatted text that is inserted into the document, for example using setHtml() or QTextCursor::insertHtml().
The style sheet needs to be compliant to CSS 2.1 syntax.
Note: Changing the default style sheet does not have any effect to the existing content of the document.

db:section.db:title: defaultTextOption : QTextOption
db:section.db:para: This property holds the default text option will be set on all QTextLayouts in the document.
When QTextBlocks are created, the defaultTextOption is set on their QTextLayout. This allows setting global properties for the document such as the default word wrap mode.

db:section.db:title: documentMargin : qreal
db:section.db:para: The margin around the document. The default is 4.

db:section.db:title: indentWidth : qreal
db:section.db:para: Returns the width used for text list and text block indenting.
The indent properties of QTextListFormat and QTextBlockFormat specify multiples of this value. The default indent width is 40.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.4] layoutEnabled : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether QTextDocument should recalculate the layout after every change
If this property is set to true, any change to the document triggers a layout, which makes everything work as expected but takes time.

Temporarily disabling the layout can save time when making multiple changes (not just text content, but also default font, default text option....) so that the document is only laid out once at the end. This can be useful when the text width or page size isn't yet known, for instance.
By default, this property is true.
This property was introduced in Qt 6.4.

db:section.db:title: maximumBlockCount : int
db:section.db:para: Specifies the limit for blocks in the document.
Specifies the maximum number of blocks the document may have. If there are more blocks in the document that specified with this property blocks are removed from the beginning of the document.
A negative or zero value specifies that the document may contain an unlimited amount of blocks.
The default value is 0.
Note that setting this property will apply the limit immediately to the document contents.
Setting this property also disables the undo redo history.
This property is undefined in documents with tables or frames.

db:section.db:title: modified : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the document has been modified by the user
By default, this property is false.

db:section.db:title: pageSize : QSizeF
db:section.db:para: This property holds the page size that should be used for laying out the document
The units are determined by the underlying paint device. The size is measured in logical pixels when painting to the screen, and in points (1/72 inch) when painting to a printer.
By default, for a newly-created, empty document, this property contains an undefined size.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] size : const QSizeF
db:section.db:para: This property holds the actual size of the document. This is equivalent to documentLayout()->documentSize();
The size of the document can be changed either by setting a text width or setting an entire page size.
Note that the width is always >= pageSize().width().
By default, for a newly-created, empty document, this property contains a configuration-dependent size.

db:section.db:title: textWidth : qreal
db:section.db:para: The text width specifies the preferred width for text in the document. If the text (or content in general) is wider than the specified with it is broken into multiple lines and grows vertically. If the text cannot be broken into multiple lines to fit into the specified text width it will be larger and the size() and the idealWidth() property will reflect that.
If the text width is set to -1 then the text will not be broken into multiple lines unless it is enforced through an explicit line break or a new paragraph.
The default value is -1.

Setting the text width will also set the page height to -1, causing the document to grow or shrink vertically in a continuous way. If you want the document layout to break the text into multiple pages then you have to set the pageSize property instead.

db:section.db:title: undoRedoEnabled : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether undo/redo are enabled for this document
This defaults to true. If disabled, the undo stack is cleared and no items will be added to it.

db:section.db:title: useDesignMetrics : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether the document uses design metrics of fonts to improve the accuracy of text layout
If this property is set to true, the layout will use design metrics. Otherwise, the metrics of the paint device as set on QAbstractTextDocumentLayout::setPaintDevice() will be used.

Using design metrics makes a layout have a width that is no longer dependent on hinting and pixel-rounding. This means that WYSIWYG text layout becomes possible because the width scales much more linearly based on paintdevice metrics than it would otherwise.
By default, this property is false.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextDocument::QTextDocument(QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty QTextDocument with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextDocument::QTextDocument(const QString &text, QObject *parent = nullptr)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QTextDocument containing the plain (unformatted) text specified, and with the given parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QTextDocument::~QTextDocument()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::addResource(int type, const QUrl &name, const QVariant &resource)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void addResource(int type, const QUrl &name, const QVariant &resource)

db:section.db:para: Adds the resource resource to the resource cache, using type and name as identifiers. type should be a value from QTextDocument::ResourceType.
For example, you can add an image as a resource in order to reference it from within the document:
The image can be inserted into the document using the QTextCursor API:
Alternatively, you can insert images using the HTML img tag:

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::adjustSize()
db:section.db:para: Adjusts the document to a reasonable size.

db:section.db:title: QList<QTextFormat> QTextDocument::allFormats() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of text formats for all the formats used in the document.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::availableRedoSteps() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of available redo steps.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::availableUndoSteps() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of available undo steps.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] qreal QTextDocument::baselineOffset() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the the baseline offset in % used in the document layout.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::begin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document's first text block.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::blockCountChanged(int newBlockCount)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the total number of text blocks in the document changes. The value passed in newBlockCount is the new total.

db:section.db:title: QChar QTextDocument::characterAt(int pos) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the character at position pos, or a null character if the position is out of range.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::characterCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of characters of this document.

db:note.db:para: As a QTextDocument always contains at least one QChar::ParagraphSeparator, this method will return at least 1.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QTextDocument::clear()
db:section.db:para: Clears the document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::clearUndoRedoStacks(QTextDocument::Stacks stacksToClear = UndoAndRedoStacks)
db:section.db:para: Clears the stacks specified by stacksToClear.

This method clears any commands on the undo stack, the redo stack, or both (the default). If commands are cleared, the appropriate signals are emitted, QTextDocument::undoAvailable() or QTextDocument::redoAvailable().

db:section.db:title: QTextDocument *QTextDocument::clone(QObject *parent = nullptr) const
db:section.db:para: Creates a new QTextDocument that is a copy of this text document. parent is the parent of the returned text document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::contentsChange(int position, int charsRemoved, int charsAdded)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void contentsChange(int position, int charsRemoved, int charsAdded)

db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the document's content changes; for example, when text is inserted or deleted, or when formatting is applied.

Information is provided about the position of the character in the document where the change occurred, the number of characters removed (charsRemoved), and the number of characters added (charsAdded).
The signal is emitted before the document's layout manager is notified about the change. This hook allows you to implement syntax highlighting for the document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::contentsChanged()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the document's content changes; for example, when text is inserted or deleted, or when formatting is applied.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] QTextObject *QTextDocument::createObject(const QTextFormat &format)
db:section.db:para: Creates and returns a new document object (a QTextObject), based on the given format.
QTextObjects will always get created through this method, so you must reimplement it if you use custom text objects inside your document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::cursorPositionChanged(const QTextCursor &cursor)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the position of a cursor changed due to an editing operation. The cursor that changed is passed in cursor. If the document is used with the QTextEdit class and you need a signal when the cursor is moved with the arrow keys you can use the cursorPositionChanged() signal in QTextEdit.

db:section.db:title: Qt::CursorMoveStyle QTextDocument::defaultCursorMoveStyle() const
db:section.db:para: The default cursor movement style is used by all QTextCursor objects created from the document. The default is Qt::LogicalMoveStyle.

db:section.db:title: QFont QTextDocument::defaultFont() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the default font to be used in the document layout.

db:section.db:title: [static, since 6.1] QTextDocument::ResourceProvider QTextDocument::defaultResourceProvider()
db:section.db:para: Returns the default resource provider.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: QTextOption QTextDocument::defaultTextOption() const
db:section.db:para: The default text option is used on all QTextLayout objects in the document. This allows setting global properties for the document such as the default word wrap mode.

db:section.db:title: QAbstractTextDocumentLayout *QTextDocument::documentLayout() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document layout for this document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::documentLayoutChanged()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a new document layout is set.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::drawContents(QPainter *p, const QRectF &rect = QRectF())
db:section.db:para: Draws the content of the document with painter p, clipped to rect. If rect is a null rectangle (default) then the document is painted unclipped.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::end() const
db:section.db:para: This function returns a block to test for the end of the document while iterating over it.
db:section.db:programlisting: for (QTextBlock it = doc->begin(); it != doc->end(); it = it.next()) std::cout << it.text().toStdString() << "\n";
db:section.db:para: The block returned is invalid and represents the block after the last block in the document. You can use lastBlock() to retrieve the last valid block of the document.

db:section.db:title: QTextCursor QTextDocument::find(const QString &subString, const QTextCursor &cursor, QTextDocument::FindFlags options = FindFlags()) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QTextCursor find(const QString &subString, const QTextCursor &cursor, QTextDocument::FindFlags options) const

db:section.db:para: Finds the next occurrence of the string, subString, in the document. The search starts at the position of the given cursor, and proceeds forwards through the document unless specified otherwise in the search options. The options control the type of search performed.
Returns a cursor with the match selected if subString was found; otherwise returns a null cursor.
If the given cursor has a selection, the search begins after the selection; otherwise it begins at the cursor's position.
By default the search is case insensitive, and can match text anywhere in the document.

db:section.db:title: QTextCursor QTextDocument::find(const QString &subString, int position = 0, QTextDocument::FindFlags options = FindFlags()) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QTextCursor find(const QString &subString, int position, QTextDocument::FindFlags options) const

db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Finds the next occurrence of the string, subString, in the document. The search starts at the given position, and proceeds forwards through the document unless specified otherwise in the search options. The options control the type of search performed.
Returns a cursor with the match selected if subString was found; otherwise returns a null cursor.
If the position is 0 (the default) the search begins from the beginning of the document; otherwise it begins at the specified position.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QTextCursor QTextDocument::find(const QRegularExpression &expr, int from = 0, QTextDocument::FindFlags options = FindFlags()) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QTextCursor find(const QRegularExpression &expr, int from, QTextDocument::FindFlags options) const

db:section.db:para: Finds the next occurrence that matches the given regular expression, expr, within the same paragraph in the document.
The search starts at the given from position, and proceeds forwards through the document unless specified otherwise in the search options. The options control the type of search performed.
Returns a cursor with the match selected if a match was found; otherwise returns a null cursor.
If the from position is 0 (the default) the search begins from the beginning of the document; otherwise it begins at the specified position.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QTextCursor QTextDocument::find(const QRegularExpression &expr, const QTextCursor &cursor, QTextDocument::FindFlags options = FindFlags()) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QTextCursor find(const QRegularExpression &expr, const QTextCursor &cursor, QTextDocument::FindFlags options) const

db:section.db:para: Finds the next occurrence that matches the given regular expression, expr, within the same paragraph in the document.
The search starts at the position of the given cursor, and proceeds forwards through the document unless specified otherwise in the search options. The options control the type of search performed.
Returns a cursor with the match selected if a match was found; otherwise returns a null cursor.
If the given cursor has a selection, the search begins after the selection; otherwise it begins at the cursor's position.
By default the search is case insensitive, and can match text anywhere in the document.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::findBlock(int pos) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text block that contains the pos-th character.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::findBlockByLineNumber(int lineNumber) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text block that contains the specified lineNumber.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::findBlockByNumber(int blockNumber) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text block with the specified blockNumber.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::firstBlock() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document's first text block.

db:section.db:title: qreal QTextDocument::idealWidth() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the ideal width of the text document. The ideal width is the actually used width of the document without optional alignments taken into account. It is always <= size().width().

db:section.db:title: bool QTextDocument::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the document is empty; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextDocument::isRedoAvailable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if redo is available; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextDocument::isUndoAvailable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if undo is available; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QTextBlock QTextDocument::lastBlock() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document's last (valid) text block.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::lineCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of lines of this document (if the layout supports this). Otherwise, this is identical to the number of blocks.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] QVariant QTextDocument::loadResource(int type, const QUrl &name)
db:section.db:para: Loads data of the specified type from the resource with the given name.

This function is called by the rich text engine to request data that isn't directly stored by QTextDocument, but still associated with it. For example, images are referenced indirectly by the name attribute of a QTextImageFormat object.
When called by Qt, type is one of the values of QTextDocument::ResourceType.

If the QTextDocument is a child object of a QObject that has an invokable loadResource method such as QTextEdit, QTextBrowser or a QTextDocument itself then the default implementation tries to retrieve the data from the parent.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::markContentsDirty(int position, int length)
db:section.db:para: Marks the contents specified by the given position and length as "dirty", informing the document that it needs to be laid out again.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextDocument::metaInformation(QTextDocument::MetaInformation info) const
db:section.db:para: Returns meta information about the document of the type specified by info.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::modificationChanged(bool changed)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the content of the document changes in a way that affects the modification state. If changed is true, the document has been modified; otherwise it is false.

For example, calling setModified(false) on a document and then inserting text causes the signal to get emitted. If you undo that operation, causing the document to return to its original unmodified state, the signal will get emitted again.

db:section.db:title: QTextObject *QTextDocument::object(int objectIndex) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text object associated with the given objectIndex.

db:section.db:title: QTextObject *QTextDocument::objectForFormat(const QTextFormat &f) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text object associated with the format f.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::pageCount() const
db:section.db:para: returns the number of pages in this document.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::print(QPagedPaintDevice *printer) const
db:section.db:para: Prints the document to the given printer. The QPagedPaintDevice must be set up before being used with this function.
This is only a convenience method to print the whole document to the printer.
If the document is already paginated through a specified height in the pageSize() property it is printed as-is.

If the document is not paginated, like for example a document used in a QTextEdit, then a temporary copy of the document is created and the copy is broken into multiple pages according to the size of the paint device's paperRect(). By default a 2 cm margin is set around the document contents. In addition the current page number is printed at the bottom of each page.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::redo(QTextCursor *cursor)
db:section.db:para: Redoes the last editing operation on the document if redo is available.
The provided cursor is positioned at the end of the location where the edition operation was redone.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::redo()
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Redoes the last editing operation on the document if redo is available.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::redoAvailable(bool available)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever redo operations become available (available is true) or unavailable (available is false).

db:section.db:title: QVariant QTextDocument::resource(int type, const QUrl &name) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVariant resource(int type, const QUrl &name) const

db:section.db:para: Returns data of the specified type from the resource with the given name.

This function is called by the rich text engine to request data that isn't directly stored by QTextDocument, but still associated with it. For example, images are referenced indirectly by the name attribute of a QTextImageFormat object.

Resources are cached internally in the document. If a resource can not be found in the cache, loadResource is called to try to load the resource. loadResource should then use addResource to add the resource to the cache.

If loadResource does not load the resource, then the resourceProvider and lastly the defaultResourceProvider will be called, if set. Note that the result from the provider will not be added automatically to the cache.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] QTextDocument::ResourceProvider QTextDocument::resourceProvider() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the resource provider for this text document.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: int QTextDocument::revision() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document's revision (if undo is enabled).
The revision is guaranteed to increase when a document that is not modified is edited.

db:section.db:title: QTextFrame *QTextDocument::rootFrame() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the document's root frame.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] void QTextDocument::setBaselineOffset(qreal baseline)
db:section.db:para: Sets the base line as a% of font height to use in the document layout to baseline. The default value is 0. A positive value moves up the text, by the corresponding %; a negative value moves it down.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setDefaultCursorMoveStyle(Qt::CursorMoveStyle style)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default cursor movement style to the given style.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setDefaultFont(const QFont &font)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default font to use in the document layout.

db:section.db:title: [static, since 6.1] void QTextDocument::setDefaultResourceProvider(const QTextDocument::ResourceProvider &provider)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default resource provider to provider.
The default provider will be used by all QTextDocuments that don't have an explicit provider set.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setDefaultTextOption(const QTextOption &option)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default text option to option.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setDocumentLayout(QAbstractTextDocumentLayout *layout)
db:section.db:para: Sets the document to use the given layout. The previous layout is deleted.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setHtml(const QString &html)
db:section.db:para: Replaces the entire contents of the document with the given HTML-formatted text in the html string. The undo/redo history is reset when this function is called.
The HTML formatting is respected as much as possible; for example, "bold text" will produce text where the first word has a font weight that gives it a bold appearance: "bold text".
To select a css media rule other than the default "screen" rule, use setMetaInformation() with 'CssMedia' as "info" parameter.

db:note.db:para: It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that the text is correctly decoded when a QString containing HTML is created and passed to setHtml().

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setIndentWidth(qreal width)
db:section.db:para: Sets the width used for text list and text block indenting.
The indent properties of QTextListFormat and QTextBlockFormat specify multiples of this value. The default indent width is 40 .

db:section.db:title: [since 5.14] void QTextDocument::setMarkdown(const QString &markdown, QTextDocument::MarkdownFeatures features = MarkdownDialectGitHub)
db:section.db:para: Replaces the entire contents of the document with the given Markdown-formatted text in the markdown string, with the given features supported. By default, all supported GitHub-style Markdown features are included; pass MarkdownDialectCommonMark for a more basic parse.
The Markdown formatting is respected as much as possible; for example, "*bold* text" will produce text where the first word has a font weight that gives it an emphasized appearance.
Parsing of HTML included in the markdown string is handled in the same way as in setHtml; however, Markdown formatting inside HTML blocks is not supported.
Some features of the parser can be enabled or disabled via the features argument:

db:td.db:para: Any HTML tags in the Markdown text will be discarded
The parser supports only the features standardized by CommonMark
The parser supports the GitHub dialect

db:section.db:para: The default is MarkdownDialectGitHub.
The undo/redo history is reset when this function is called.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.14.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setMetaInformation(QTextDocument::MetaInformation info, const QString &string)
db:section.db:para: Sets the document's meta information of the type specified by info to the given string.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::setPlainText(const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Replaces the entire contents of the document with the given plain text. The undo/redo history is reset when this function is called.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] void QTextDocument::setResourceProvider(const QTextDocument::ResourceProvider &provider)
db:section.db:para: Sets the provider of resources for the text document to provider.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] void QTextDocument::setSubScriptBaseline(qreal baseline)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default subscript's base line as a % of font height to use in the document layout to baseline. The default value is 16.67% (1/6 of height).
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] void QTextDocument::setSuperScriptBaseline(qreal baseline)
db:section.db:para: Sets the default superscript's base line as a % of font height to use in the document layout to baseline. The default value is 50% (1/2 of height).
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] qreal QTextDocument::subScriptBaseline() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the superscript's base line as a % of font height used in the document layout.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.0] qreal QTextDocument::superScriptBaseline() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the superscript's base line as a % of font height used in the document layout.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextDocument::toHtml() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string containing an HTML representation of the document.

The content of the document specifies its encoding to be UTF-8. If you later on convert the returned html string into a byte array for transmission over a network or when saving to disk you should use QString::toUtf8() to convert the string to a QByteArray.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.14] QString QTextDocument::toMarkdown(QTextDocument::MarkdownFeatures features = MarkdownDialectGitHub) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string containing a Markdown representation of the document with the given features, or an empty string if writing fails for any reason.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.14.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextDocument::toPlainText() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the plain text contained in the document. If you want formatting information use a QTextCursor instead.

This function returns the same as toRawText(), but will replace some unicode characters with ASCII alternatives. In particular, no-break space (U+00A0) is replaced by a regular space (U+0020), and both paragraph (U+2029) and line (U+2028) separators are replaced by line feed (U+000A). If you need the precise contents of the document, use toRawText() instead.

db:note.db:para: Embedded objects, such as images, are represented by a Unicode value U+FFFC (OBJECT REPLACEMENT CHARACTER).

db:section.db:title: [since 5.9] QString QTextDocument::toRawText() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the raw text contained in the document without any formatting information. If you want formatting information use a QTextCursor instead.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.9.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::undo(QTextCursor *cursor)
db:section.db:para: Undoes the last editing operation on the document if undo is available. The provided cursor is positioned at the end of the location where the edition operation was undone.
See the Qt Undo Framework documentation for details.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::undo()
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::undoAvailable(bool available)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever undo operations become available (available is true) or unavailable (available is false).
See the Qt Undo Framework documentation for details.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDocument::undoCommandAdded()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted every time a new level of undo is added to the QTextDocument.
